channel.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
channel.description:
Linux can do everything :). I find it amusing how many things people have ported Linux to.
Linux on a DS http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dslinux [img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dc/Ds_lite_with_slot-2_device_running_dslinux.jpg/250px-Ds_lite_with_slot-2_device_running_dslinux.jpg[/img]
Linux on an ipad: http://www.pcworld.com/article/239059/linux_now_runs_on_ipad_tuxedo_optional.html [img]http://zapp5.staticworld.net/images/article/2011/08/ipadlinux-5211495.jpg[/img]
Linux on Mobile phones: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linux_Phone_Standards_Forum [img]http://www.palminfocenter.com/images/treo650_linux.jpg[/img]
Linux on PS3: http://talkbinary.com/linux/installing-yellow-dog-linux-on-a-ps3-with-video/ [img]http://talkbinary.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/07/linux-install-300x191.jpg[/img]
On an X-Box: http://forums.xbox-scene.com/index.php?showtopic=595902
On a Gameboy Advanced: http://www.kernelthread.com/publications/gbaunix/ [img]http://www.kernelthread.com/publications/gbaunix/images/gbaunix.gif[/img]
I bet there are more, but this is all i found.

item.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
item.dc:creator: @amfg amfg
item.description:
@amfg wrote:

Too bad putting it on those devices renders them useless.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

any os can be installed on anything assuming that it can be compiled for it. this means that the person developing for said device must have an intricate knowledge of the ISA for the device.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

well its not installed. the ubuntu runs in chroot and windows 98 runs on qemu. I can put links to how i got them up. im waiting for ubuntu to be installable as an app(http://www.ubuntu.com/devices/android idk if its an app you install or the manufactures include it with the phone.)

Read full topic

item.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

I never understood some of these, yes it would be cool to be the one to actually create the linux port for these devices, but to be an end user you can always pick up a cheap netbook and run linux.

Its not for the ‘effectiveness’ of the end result, more of the fact that it can be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:437527”]I wish the PSP had an MMU. That would make porting it to the PSP MUCH easier. Sure, I could use uCLinux, but I’d still need to bypass the IPL (which, seeing as I only have a Slim, is very annoying).

And (as Arch Linux states) you could install Linux on a Kerosene powered cheese-grater if you wanted.[/quote]

The PSP dosn’t have a MMU? I never touched one, so i wouldn’t know.

And ArchLinux also states you should contact them before installing it on one

Read full topic
item.source: Linux can be installed on anything <3

item.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I wish the PSP had an MMU. That would make porting it to the PSP MUCH easier. Sure, I could use uCLinux, but I’d still need to bypass the IPL (which, seeing as I only have a Slim, is very annoying).

And (as Arch Linux states) you could install Linux on a Kerosene powered cheese-grater if you wanted.

Read full topic
item.source: Linux can be installed on anything <3

item.title: Linux can be installed on anything <3
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

Linux can do everything :). I find it amusing how many things people have ported Linux to.

Linux on a DS
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dslinux

Linux on an ipad:

PCWorld

Linux Now Runs on iPad; Tuxedo Optional

You love the iPad's hardware, but you also love open-source, you say? This hack may be the best of both worlds.


Linux on Mobile phones:

en.wikipedia.org

Linux Phone Standards Forum

The Linux Phone Standards Forum (LiPS Forum) is a consortium of a group of companies to create standards for the use of Linux on mobile devices. The main goal of the LiPS Forum is to create application programming interfaces (APIs) that will allow developers to build applications to inter-operate across Linux handsets made by all manufacturers. Founding members include ARM Ltd, Cellon, Esmertec, France Telecom, Telecom Italia, FSM Labs, Huawei, Jaluna, MIZI Research, MontaVista Software, Open- Ne...


Linux on PS3:
http://talkbinary.com/linux/installing-yellow-dog-linux-on-a-ps3-with-video/

On an X-Box:
http://forums.xbox-scene.com/index.php?showtopic=595902

On a Gameboy Advanced:
http://www.kernelthread.com/publications/gbaunix/

I bet there are more, but this is all i found.

Read full topic
